p: Another potential explanation may be the unique intersection between depressive symptoms, alcohol use, and social isolation in Vietnam. Men may respond to experiences of depression with social isolation [ 72, 73], leading to reduced alcohol use as drinking alone is uncommon [ 23, 24]. Instead, drinking centers around social interactions in Vietnam [ 23, 24, 74]. Those experiencing the co-occurrence of heightened alcohol use and depressive symptoms may represent a particularly isolated group that is not engaging with their partner, leaving limited opportunity for alcohol-related IPV events to occur. Research is needed to understand the circumstances under which men with HIV may or may not use alcohol as a coping strategy when experiencing depressive symptoms.
